00077 /*
00078  * pollarray:
00079  *      array of struct pollfd suitable to pass to poll. initialized to
00080  *      zero - a zero struct is ignored by poll() because the events mask is 0.
00081  *
00082  * clnt_list:
00083  *      linked list of struct clnt_info which associates a clntXXX directory
00084  *      with an index into pollarray[], and other basic data about that client.
00085  *
00086  * Directory structure: created by the kernel nfs client
00087  *      {pipefs_nfsdir}/clntXX             : one per rpc_clnt struct in the kernel
00088  *      {pipefs_nfsdir}/clntXX/krb5        : read uid for which kernel wants
00089  *                                          a context, write the resulting context
00090  *      {pipefs_nfsdir}/clntXX/info        : stores info such as server name
00091  *
00092  * Algorithm:
00093  *      Poll all {pipefs_nfsdir}/clntXX/krb5 files.  When ready, data read
00094  *      is a uid; performs rpcsec_gss context initialization protocol to
00095  *      get a cred for that user.  Writes result to corresponding krb5 file
00096  *      in a form the kernel code will understand.
00097  *      In addition, we make sure we are notified whenever anything is
00098  *      created or destroyed in {pipefs_nfsdir} or in an of the clntXX directories,
00099  *      and rescan the whole {pipefs_nfsdir} when this happens.
00100  */
00101 
00102 struct pollfd * pollarray;
00103 
00104 int pollsize;  /* the size of pollaray (in pollfd's) */
00105 
00106 static void
00107 destroy_client(struct clnt_info *clp)
00108 {
00109         printerr(3, "clp %p: dirname %s, krb5fd %d\n", clp, clp->dirname, clp->krb5_fd);
00110         if (clp->krb5_poll_index != -1)
00111                 memset(&pollarray[clp->krb5_poll_index], 0,
00112                                         sizeof(struct pollfd));
00113         if (clp->spkm3_poll_index != -1)
00114                 memset(&pollarray[clp->spkm3_poll_index], 0,
00115                                         sizeof(struct pollfd));
00116         if (clp->dir_fd != -1) close(clp->dir_fd);
00117         if (clp->krb5_fd != -1) close(clp->krb5_fd);
00118         if (clp->spkm3_fd != -1) close(clp->spkm3_fd);
00119         if (clp->dirname) free(clp->dirname);
00120         if (clp->servicename) free(clp->servicename);
00121         free(clp);
00122 }
00123 
00124 static struct clnt_info *
00125 insert_new_clnt(void)
00126 {
00127         struct clnt_info        *clp = NULL;
00128 
00129         if (!(clp = (struct clnt_info *)calloc(1,sizeof(struct clnt_info)))) {
00130                 printerr(0, "ERROR: can't malloc clnt_info: %s\n",
00131                          strerror(errno));
00132                 goto out;
00133         }
00134         clp->krb5_poll_index = -1;
00135         clp->spkm3_poll_index = -1;
00136         clp->krb5_fd = -1;
00137         clp->spkm3_fd = -1;
00138         clp->dir_fd = -1;
00139 
00140         TAILQ_INSERT_HEAD(&clnt_list, clp, list);
00141 out:
00142         return clp;
00143 }
00144 
00145 static int
00146 process_clnt_dir_files(struct clnt_info * clp)
00147 {
00148         char    kname[32];
00149         char    sname[32];
00150 
00151         if (clp->krb5_fd == -1) {
00152                 snprintf(kname, sizeof(kname), "%s/krb5", clp->dirname);
00153                 clp->krb5_fd = open(kname, O_RDWR);
00154         }
00155         if (clp->spkm3_fd == -1) {
00156                 snprintf(sname, sizeof(sname), "%s/spkm3", clp->dirname);
00157                 clp->spkm3_fd = open(sname, O_RDWR);
00158         }
00159         if((clp->krb5_fd == -1) && (clp->spkm3_fd == -1))
00160                 return -1;
00161         return 0;
00162 }
00163 
00164 static int
00165 get_poll_index(int *ind)
00166 {
00167         int i;
00168 
00169         *ind = -1;
00170         for (i=0; i<FD_ALLOC_BLOCK; i++) {
00171                 if (pollarray[i].events == 0) {
00172                         *ind = i;
00173                         break;
00174                 }
00175         }
00176         if (*ind == -1) {
00177                 printerr(0, "ERROR: No pollarray slots open\n");
00178                 return -1;
00179         }
00180         return 0;
00181 }
00182 
00183 
00184 static int
00185 insert_clnt_poll(struct clnt_info *clp)
00186 {
00187         if ((clp->krb5_fd != -1) && (clp->krb5_poll_index == -1)) {
00188                 if (get_poll_index(&clp->krb5_poll_index)) {
00189                         printerr(0, "ERROR: Too many krb5 clients\n");
00190                         return -1;
00191                 }
00192                 pollarray[clp->krb5_poll_index].fd = clp->krb5_fd;
00193                 pollarray[clp->krb5_poll_index].events |= POLLIN;
00194                 printerr(2, "monitoring krb5 channel under %s\n",
00195                          clp->dirname);
00196         }
00197 
00198         if ((clp->spkm3_fd != -1) && (clp->spkm3_poll_index == -1)) {
00199                 if (get_poll_index(&clp->spkm3_poll_index)) {
00200                         printerr(0, "ERROR: Too many spkm3 clients\n");
00201                         return -1;
00202                 }
00203                 pollarray[clp->spkm3_poll_index].fd = clp->spkm3_fd;
00204                 pollarray[clp->spkm3_poll_index].events |= POLLIN;
00205         }
00206 
00207         return 0;
00208 }
00209 
00210 static void
00211 process_clnt_dir(char *dir)
00212 {
00213         struct clnt_info *      clp;
00214 
00215         if (!(clp = insert_new_clnt()))
00216                 goto fail_destroy_client;
00217 
00218         if (!(clp->dirname = calloc(strlen(dir) + 1, 1))) {
00219                 goto fail_destroy_client;
00220         }
00221         memcpy(clp->dirname, dir, strlen(dir));
00222         if ((clp->dir_fd = open(clp->dirname, O_RDONLY)) == -1) {
00223                 printerr(0, "ERROR: can't open %s: %s\n",
00224                          clp->dirname, strerror(errno));
00225                 goto fail_destroy_client;
00226         }
00227         fcntl(clp->dir_fd, F_SETSIG, DNOTIFY_SIGNAL);
00228         fcntl(clp->dir_fd, F_NOTIFY, DN_CREATE | DN_DELETE | DN_MULTISHOT);
00229 
00230         if (process_clnt_dir_files(clp))
00231                 goto fail_keep_client;
00232 
00233         if (insert_clnt_poll(clp))
00234                 goto fail_destroy_client;
00235 
00236         return;
00237 
00238 fail_destroy_client:
00239         if (clp) {
00240                 TAILQ_REMOVE(&clnt_list, clp, list);
00241                 destroy_client(clp);
00242         }
00243 fail_keep_client:
00244         /* We couldn't find some subdirectories, but we keep the client
00245          * around in case we get a notification on the directory when the
00246          * subdirectories are created. */
00247         return;
00248 }
00249 
00250 void
00251 init_client_list(void)
00252 {
00253         TAILQ_INIT(&clnt_list);
00254         /* Eventually plan to grow/shrink poll array: */
00255         pollsize = FD_ALLOC_BLOCK;
00256         pollarray = calloc(pollsize, sizeof(struct pollfd));
00257 }
00258 
00259 /*
00260  * This is run after a DNOTIFY signal, and should clear up any
00261  * directories that are no longer around, and re-scan any existing
00262  * directories, since the DNOTIFY could have been in there.
00263  */
00264 static void
00265 update_old_clients(struct dirent **namelist, int size)
00266 {
00267         struct clnt_info *clp;
00268         void *saveprev;
00269         int i, stillhere;
00270 
00271         for (clp = clnt_list.tqh_first; clp != NULL; clp = clp->list.tqe_next) {
00272                 stillhere = 0;
00273                 for (i=0; i < size; i++) {
00274                         if (!strcmp(clp->dirname, namelist[i]->d_name)) {
00275                                 stillhere = 1;
00276                                 break;
00277                         }
00278                 }
00279                 if (!stillhere) {
00280                         printerr(2, "destroying client %s\n", clp->dirname);
00281                         saveprev = clp->list.tqe_prev;
00282                         TAILQ_REMOVE(&clnt_list, clp, list);
00283                         destroy_client(clp);
00284                         clp = saveprev;
00285                 }
00286         }
00287         for (clp = clnt_list.tqh_first; clp != NULL; clp = clp->list.tqe_next) {
00288                 if (!process_clnt_dir_files(clp))
00289                         insert_clnt_poll(clp);
00290         }
00291 }
00292 
00293 /* Search for a client by directory name, return 1 if found, 0 otherwise */
00294 static int
00295 find_client(char *dirname)
00296 {
00297         struct clnt_info        *clp;
00298 
00299         for (clp = clnt_list.tqh_first; clp != NULL; clp = clp->list.tqe_next)
00300                 if (!strcmp(clp->dirname, dirname))
00301                         return 1;
00302         return 0;
00303 }
00304 
00305 /* Used to read (and re-read) list of clients, set up poll array. */
00306 int
00307 update_client_list(void)
00308 {
00309         char lustre_dir[PATH_MAX];
00310         struct dirent lustre_dirent = { .d_name = "lustre" };
00311         struct dirent *namelist[1];
00312         struct stat statbuf;
00313         int i, j;
00314 
00315         if (chdir(pipefs_dir) < 0) {
00316                 printerr(0, "ERROR: can't chdir to %s: %s\n",
00317                          pipefs_dir, strerror(errno));
00318                 return -1;
00319         }
00320 
00321         snprintf(lustre_dir, sizeof(lustre_dir), "%s/%s", pipefs_dir, "lustre");
00322         if (stat(lustre_dir, &statbuf) == 0) {
00323                 namelist[0] = &lustre_dirent;
00324                 j = 1;
00325                 printerr(2, "re-processing lustre directory\n");
00326         } else {
00327                 namelist[0] = NULL;
00328                 j = 0;
00329                 printerr(2, "lustre directory not exist\n");
00330         }
00331 
00332         update_old_clients(namelist, j);
00333         for (i=0; i < j; i++) {
00334                 if (i < FD_ALLOC_BLOCK && !find_client(namelist[i]->d_name))
00335                         process_clnt_dir(namelist[i]->d_name);
00336         }
00337 
00338         chdir("/");
00339         return 0;
00340 }
00341 
00342 /* Context creation response. */
00343 struct lustre_gss_init_res {
00344         gss_buffer_desc gr_ctx;         /* context handle */
00345         unsigned int    gr_major;       /* major status */
00346         unsigned int    gr_minor;       /* minor status */
00347         unsigned int    gr_win;         /* sequence window */
00348         gss_buffer_desc gr_token;       /* token */
00349 };
00350 
00351 struct lustre_gss_data {
00352         int             lgd_established;
00353         int             lgd_lustre_svc; /* mds/oss */
00354         int             lgd_uid;        /* uid */
00355         char           *lgd_uuid;       /* client device uuid */
00356         gss_name_t      lgd_name;       /* service name */
00357 
00358         gss_OID         lgd_mech;       /* mech OID */
00359         unsigned int    lgd_req_flags;  /* request flags */
00360         gss_cred_id_t   lgd_cred;       /* credential */
00361         gss_ctx_id_t    lgd_ctx;        /* session context */
00362         gss_buffer_desc lgd_rmt_ctx;    /* remote handle of context */
00363         uint32_t        lgd_seq_win;    /* sequence window */
00364 
00365         int             lgd_rpc_err;
00366         int             lgd_gss_err;
00367 };
00368 
00369 static int
00370 do_downcall(int k5_fd, struct lgssd_upcall_data *updata,
00371             struct lustre_gss_data *lgd, gss_buffer_desc *context_token)
00372 {
00373         char    *buf = NULL, *p = NULL, *end = NULL;
00374         unsigned int timeout = 0; /* XXX decide on a reasonable value */
00375         unsigned int buf_size = 0;
00376 
00377         printerr(2, "doing downcall\n");
00378         buf_size = sizeof(updata->seq) + sizeof(timeout) +
00379                 sizeof(lgd->lgd_seq_win) +
00380                 sizeof(lgd->lgd_rmt_ctx.length) + lgd->lgd_rmt_ctx.length +
00381                 sizeof(context_token->length) + context_token->length;
00382         p = buf = malloc(buf_size);
00383         end = buf + buf_size;
00384 
00385         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, updata->seq)) goto out_err;
00386         /* Not setting any timeout for now: */
00387         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, timeout)) goto out_err;
00388         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, lgd->lgd_seq_win)) goto out_err;
00389         if (write_buffer(&p, end, &lgd->lgd_rmt_ctx)) goto out_err;
00390         if (write_buffer(&p, end, context_token)) goto out_err;
00391 
00392         lgssd_mutex_get(lgssd_mutex_downcall);
00393         if (write(k5_fd, buf, p - buf) < p - buf) {
00394                 lgssd_mutex_put(lgssd_mutex_downcall);
00395                 goto out_err;
00396         }
00397         lgssd_mutex_put(lgssd_mutex_downcall);
00398 
00399         if (buf) free(buf);
00400         return 0;
00401 out_err:
00402         if (buf) free(buf);
00403         printerr(0, "ERROR: Failed to write downcall!\n");
00404         return -1;
00405 }
00406 
00407 static int
00408 do_error_downcall(int k5_fd, uint32_t seq, int rpc_err, int gss_err)
00409 {
00410         char    buf[1024];
00411         char    *p = buf, *end = buf + 1024;
00412         unsigned int timeout = 0;
00413         int     zero = 0;
00414 
00415         printerr(1, "doing error downcall\n");
00416 
00417         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, seq)) goto out_err;
00418         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, timeout)) goto out_err;
00419         /* use seq_win = 0 to indicate an error: */
00420         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, zero)) goto out_err;
00421         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, rpc_err)) goto out_err;
00422         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, gss_err)) goto out_err;
00423 
00424         lgssd_mutex_get(lgssd_mutex_downcall);
00425         if (write(k5_fd, buf, p - buf) < p - buf) {
00426                 lgssd_mutex_put(lgssd_mutex_downcall);
00427                 goto out_err;
00428         }
00429         lgssd_mutex_put(lgssd_mutex_downcall);
00430         return 0;
00431 out_err:
00432         printerr(0, "Failed to write error downcall!\n");
00433         return -1;
00434 }
00435 
00436 #if 0
00437 /*
00438  * Create an RPC connection and establish an authenticated
00439  * gss context with a server.
00440  */
00441 int create_auth_rpc_client(struct clnt_info *clp,
00442                            CLIENT **clnt_return,
00443                            AUTH **auth_return,
00444                            uid_t uid,
00445                            int authtype)
00446 {
00447         CLIENT                  *rpc_clnt = NULL;
00448         struct rpc_gss_sec      sec;
00449         AUTH                    *auth = NULL;
00450         uid_t                   save_uid = -1;
00451         int                     retval = -1;
00452         int                     errcode;
00453         OM_uint32               min_stat;
00454         char                    rpc_errmsg[1024];
00455         int                     sockp = RPC_ANYSOCK;
00456         int                     sendsz = 32768, recvsz = 32768;
00457         struct addrinfo         ai_hints, *a = NULL;
00458         char                    service[64];
00459         char                    *at_sign;
00460 
00461         /* Create the context as the user (not as root) */
00462         save_uid = geteuid();
00463         if (setfsuid(uid) != 0) {
00464                 printerr(0, "WARNING: Failed to setfsuid for "
00465                             "user with uid %d\n", uid);
00466                 goto out_fail;
00467         }
00468         printerr(2, "creating context using fsuid %d (save_uid %d)\n",
00469                         uid, save_uid);
00470 
00471         sec.qop = GSS_C_QOP_DEFAULT;
00472         sec.svc = RPCSEC_GSS_SVC_NONE;
00473         sec.cred = GSS_C_NO_CREDENTIAL;
00474         sec.req_flags = 0;
00475         if (authtype == AUTHTYPE_KRB5) {
00476                 sec.mech = (gss_OID)&krb5oid;
00477                 sec.req_flags = GSS_C_MUTUAL_FLAG;
00478         }
00479         else if (authtype == AUTHTYPE_SPKM3) {
00480                 sec.mech = (gss_OID)&spkm3oid;
00481                 /* XXX sec.req_flags = GSS_C_ANON_FLAG;
00482                  * Need a way to switch....
00483                  */
00484                 sec.req_flags = GSS_C_MUTUAL_FLAG;
00485         }
00486         else {
00487                 printerr(0, "ERROR: Invalid authentication type (%d) "
00488                         "in create_auth_rpc_client\n", authtype);
00489                 goto out_fail;
00490         }
00491 
00492 
00493         if (authtype == AUTHTYPE_KRB5) {
00494 #ifdef HAVE_SET_ALLOWABLE_ENCTYPES
00495                 /*
00496                  * Do this before creating rpc connection since we won't need
00497                  * rpc connection if it fails!
00498                  */
00499                 if (limit_krb5_enctypes(&sec, uid)) {
00500                         printerr(1, "WARNING: Failed while limiting krb5 "
00501                                     "encryption types for user with uid %d\n",
00502                                  uid);
00503                         goto out_fail;
00504                 }
00505 #endif
00506         }
00507 
00508         /* create an rpc connection to the nfs server */
00509 
00510         printerr(2, "creating %s client for server %s\n", clp->protocol,
00511                         clp->servername);
00512 
00513         memset(&ai_hints, '\0', sizeof(ai_hints));
00514         ai_hints.ai_family = PF_INET;
00515         ai_hints.ai_flags |= AI_CANONNAME;
00516         if ((strcmp(clp->protocol, "tcp")) == 0) {
00517                 ai_hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
00518                 ai_hints.ai_protocol = IPPROTO_TCP;
00519         } else if ((strcmp(clp->protocol, "udp")) == 0) {
00520                 ai_hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_DGRAM;
00521                 ai_hints.ai_protocol = IPPROTO_UDP;
00522         } else {
00523                 printerr(0, "WARNING: unrecognized protocol, '%s', requested "
00524                          "for connection to server %s for user with uid %d",
00525                          clp->protocol, clp->servername, uid);
00526                 goto out_fail;
00527         }
00528 
00529         /* extract the service name from clp->servicename */
00530         if ((at_sign = strchr(clp->servicename, '@')) == NULL) {
00531                 printerr(0, "WARNING: servicename (%s) not formatted as "
00532                         "expected with service@host", clp->servicename);
00533                 goto out_fail;
00534         }
00535         if ((at_sign - clp->servicename) >= sizeof(service)) {
00536                 printerr(0, "WARNING: service portion of servicename (%s) "
00537                         "is too long!", clp->servicename);
00538                 goto out_fail;
00539         }
00540         strncpy(service, clp->servicename, at_sign - clp->servicename);
00541         service[at_sign - clp->servicename] = '\0';
00542 
00543         errcode = getaddrinfo(clp->servername, service, &ai_hints, &a);
00544         if (errcode) {
00545                 printerr(0, "WARNING: Error from getaddrinfo for server "
00546                          "'%s': %s", clp->servername, gai_strerror(errcode));
00547                 goto out_fail;
00548         }
00549 
00550         if (a == NULL) {
00551                 printerr(0, "WARNING: No address information found for "
00552                          "connection to server %s for user with uid %d",
00553                          clp->servername, uid);
00554                 goto out_fail;
00555         }
00556         if (a->ai_protocol == IPPROTO_TCP) {
00557                 if ((rpc_clnt = clnttcp_create(
00558                                         (struct sockaddr_in *) a->ai_addr,
00559                                         clp->prog, clp->vers, &sockp,
00560                                         sendsz, recvsz)) == NULL) {
00561                         snprintf(rpc_errmsg, sizeof(rpc_errmsg),
00562                                  "WARNING: can't create tcp rpc_clnt "
00563                                  "for server %s for user with uid %d",
00564                                  clp->servername, uid);
00565                         printerr(0, "%s\n",
00566                                  clnt_spcreateerror(rpc_errmsg));
00567                         goto out_fail;
00568                 }
00569         } else if (a->ai_protocol == IPPROTO_UDP) {
00570                 const struct timeval timeout = {5, 0};
00571                 if ((rpc_clnt = clntudp_bufcreate(
00572                                         (struct sockaddr_in *) a->ai_addr,
00573                                         clp->prog, clp->vers, timeout,
00574                                         &sockp, sendsz, recvsz)) == NULL) {
00575                         snprintf(rpc_errmsg, sizeof(rpc_errmsg),
00576                                  "WARNING: can't create udp rpc_clnt "
00577                                  "for server %s for user with uid %d",
00578                                  clp->servername, uid);
00579                         printerr(0, "%s\n",
00580                                  clnt_spcreateerror(rpc_errmsg));
00581                         goto out_fail;
00582                 }
00583         } else {
00584                 /* Shouldn't happen! */
00585                 printerr(0, "ERROR: requested protocol '%s', but "
00586                          "got addrinfo with protocol %d",
00587                          clp->protocol, a->ai_protocol);
00588                 goto out_fail;
00589         }
00590         /* We're done with this */
00591         freeaddrinfo(a);
00592         a = NULL;
00593 
00594         printerr(2, "creating context with server %s\n", clp->servicename);
00595         auth = authgss_create_default(rpc_clnt, clp->servicename, &sec);
00596         if (!auth) {
00597                 /* Our caller should print appropriate message */
00598                 printerr(2, "WARNING: Failed to create %s context for "
00599                             "user with uid %d for server %s\n",
00600                         (authtype == AUTHTYPE_KRB5 ? "krb5":"spkm3"),
00601                          uid, clp->servername);
00602                 goto out_fail;
00603         }
00604 
00605         /* Success !!! */
00606         rpc_clnt->cl_auth = auth;
00607         *clnt_return = rpc_clnt;
00608         *auth_return = auth;
00609         retval = 0;
00610 
00611   out:
00612         if (sec.cred != GSS_C_NO_CREDENTIAL)
00613                 gss_release_cred(&min_stat, &sec.cred);
00614         if (a != NULL) freeaddrinfo(a);
00615         /* Restore euid to original value */
00616         if ((save_uid != -1) && (setfsuid(save_uid) != uid)) {
00617                 printerr(0, "WARNING: Failed to restore fsuid"
00618                             " to uid %d from %d\n", save_uid, uid);
00619         }
00620         return retval;
00621 
00622   out_fail:
00623         /* Only destroy here if failure.  Otherwise, caller is responsible */
00624         if (rpc_clnt) clnt_destroy(rpc_clnt);
00625 
00626         goto out;
00627 }
00628 #endif
00629 
00630 static
00631 int do_negotiation(struct lustre_gss_data *lgd,
00632                    gss_buffer_desc *gss_token,
00633                    struct lustre_gss_init_res *gr,
00634                    int timeout)
00635 {
00636         struct lgssd_ioctl_param param;
00637         struct passwd *pw;
00638         char outbuf[8192];
00639         unsigned int *p;
00640         glob_t path;
00641         int fd;
00642         int rc;
00643 
00644         pw = getpwuid(lgd->lgd_uid);
00645         if (!pw) {
00646                 printerr(0, "no uid %u in local user database\n",
00647                          lgd->lgd_uid);
00648                 return -1;
00649         }
00650 
00651         param.version = GSSD_INTERFACE_VERSION;
00652         param.uuid = lgd->lgd_uuid;
00653         param.lustre_svc = lgd->lgd_lustre_svc;
00654         param.uid = lgd->lgd_uid;
00655         param.gid = pw->pw_gid;
00656         param.send_token_size = gss_token->length;
00657         param.send_token = (char *) gss_token->value;
00658         param.reply_buf_size = sizeof(outbuf);
00659         param.reply_buf = outbuf;
00660 
00661         if (cfs_get_param_paths(&path, "sptlrpc/gss/init_channel") != 0)
00662                 return -1;
00663 
00664         fd = open(path.gl_pathv[0], O_RDWR);
00665         if (fd < 0) {
00666                 printerr(0, "can't open file %s\n", path.gl_pathv[0]);
00667                 rc = -1;
00668                 goto out_params;
00669         }
00670 
00671         rc = write(fd, &param, sizeof(param));
00672         if (rc != sizeof(param)) {
00673                 printerr(0, "lustre ioctl err: %d\n", strerror(errno));
00674                 rc = -1;
00675                 goto out_fd;
00676         }
00677         if (param.status) {
00678                 printerr(0, "status: %d (%s)\n",
00679                          param.status, strerror((int)param.status));
00680                 if (param.status == -ETIMEDOUT) {
00681                         /* kernel return -ETIMEDOUT means the rpc timedout,
00682                          * we should notify the caller to reinitiate the
00683                          * gss negotiation, by return -ERESTART
00684                          */
00685                         lgd->lgd_rpc_err = -ERESTART;
00686                         lgd->lgd_gss_err = 0;
00687                 } else {
00688                         lgd->lgd_rpc_err = param.status;
00689                         lgd->lgd_gss_err = 0;
00690                 }
00691                 rc = -1;
00692                 goto out_fd;
00693         }
00694         p = (unsigned int *)outbuf;
00695         gr->gr_major = *p++;
00696         gr->gr_minor = *p++;
00697         gr->gr_win = *p++;
00698 
00699         gr->gr_ctx.length = *p++;
00700         gr->gr_ctx.value = malloc(gr->gr_ctx.length);
00701         memcpy(gr->gr_ctx.value, p, gr->gr_ctx.length);
00702         p += (((gr->gr_ctx.length + 3) & ~3) / 4);
00703 
00704         gr->gr_token.length = *p++;
00705         gr->gr_token.value = malloc(gr->gr_token.length);
00706         memcpy(gr->gr_token.value, p, gr->gr_token.length);
00707         p += (((gr->gr_token.length + 3) & ~3) / 4);
00708 
00709         printerr(2, "do_negotiation: receive handle len %d, token len %d\n",
00710                  gr->gr_ctx.length, gr->gr_token.length);
00711         rc = 0;
00712 out_fd:
00713         close(fd);
00714 out_params:
00715         cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00716         return rc;
00717 }
00718 
00719 static
00720 int gssd_refresh_lgd(struct lustre_gss_data *lgd)
00721 {
00722         struct lustre_gss_init_res gr;
00723         gss_buffer_desc         *recv_tokenp, send_token;
00724         OM_uint32                maj_stat, min_stat, call_stat, ret_flags;
00725 
00726         /* GSS context establishment loop. */
00727         memset(&gr, 0, sizeof(gr));
00728         recv_tokenp = GSS_C_NO_BUFFER;
00729 
00730         for (;;) {
00731                 /* print the token we just received */
00732                 if (recv_tokenp != GSS_C_NO_BUFFER) {
00733                         printerr(3, "The received token length %d\n",
00734                                  recv_tokenp->length);
00735                         print_hexl(3, recv_tokenp->value, recv_tokenp->length);
00736                 }
00737 
00738                 maj_stat = gss_init_sec_context(&min_stat,
00739                                                 lgd->lgd_cred,
00740                                                 &lgd->lgd_ctx,
00741                                                 lgd->lgd_name,
00742                                                 lgd->lgd_mech,
00743                                                 lgd->lgd_req_flags,
00744                                                 0,              /* time req */
00745                                                 NULL,           /* channel */
00746                                                 recv_tokenp,
00747                                                 NULL,           /* used mech */
00748                                                 &send_token,
00749                                                 &ret_flags,
00750                                                 NULL);          /* time rec */
00751 
00752                 if (recv_tokenp != GSS_C_NO_BUFFER) {
00753                         gss_release_buffer(&min_stat, &gr.gr_token);
00754                         recv_tokenp = GSS_C_NO_BUFFER;
00755                 }
00756                 if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE &&
00757                     maj_stat != GSS_S_CONTINUE_NEEDED) {
00758                         pgsserr("gss_init_sec_context", maj_stat, min_stat,
00759                                 lgd->lgd_mech);
00760                         break;
00761                 }
00762                 if (send_token.length != 0) {
00763                         memset(&gr, 0, sizeof(gr));
00764 
00765                         /* print the token we are about to send */
00766                         printerr(3, "token being sent length %d\n",
00767                                  send_token.length);
00768                         print_hexl(3, send_token.value, send_token.length);
00769 
00770                         call_stat = do_negotiation(lgd, &send_token, &gr, 0);
00771                         gss_release_buffer(&min_stat, &send_token);
00772 
00773                         if (call_stat != 0 ||
00774                             (gr.gr_major != GSS_S_COMPLETE &&
00775                              gr.gr_major != GSS_S_CONTINUE_NEEDED)) {
00776                                 printerr(0, "call stat %d, major stat 0x%x\n",
00777                                          (int)call_stat, gr.gr_major);
00778                                 return -1;
00779                         }
00780 
00781                         if (gr.gr_ctx.length != 0) {
00782                                 if (lgd->lgd_rmt_ctx.value)
00783                                         gss_release_buffer(&min_stat,
00784                                                            &lgd->lgd_rmt_ctx);
00785                                 lgd->lgd_rmt_ctx = gr.gr_ctx;
00786                         }
00787                         if (gr.gr_token.length != 0) {
00788                                 if (maj_stat != GSS_S_CONTINUE_NEEDED)
00789                                         break;
00790                                 recv_tokenp = &gr.gr_token;
00791                         }
00792                 }
00793 
00794                 /* GSS_S_COMPLETE => check gss header verifier,
00795                  * usually checked in gss_validate
00796                  */
00797                 if (maj_stat == GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00798                         lgd->lgd_established = 1;
00799                         lgd->lgd_seq_win = gr.gr_win;
00800                         break;
00801                 }
00802         }
00803         /* End context negotiation loop. */
00804         if (!lgd->lgd_established) {
00805                 if (gr.gr_token.length != 0)
00806                         gss_release_buffer(&min_stat, &gr.gr_token);
00807 
00808                 printerr(0, "context negotiation failed\n");
00809                 return -1;
00810         }
00811 
00812         printerr(2, "successfully refreshed lgd\n");
00813         return 0;
00814 }
00815 
00816 static
00817 int gssd_create_lgd(struct clnt_info *clp,
00818                     struct lustre_gss_data *lgd,
00819                     struct lgssd_upcall_data *updata,
00820                     int authtype)
00821 {
00822         gss_buffer_desc         sname;
00823         OM_uint32               maj_stat, min_stat;
00824         int                     retval = -1;
00825 
00826         lgd->lgd_established = 0;
00827         lgd->lgd_lustre_svc = updata->svc;
00828         lgd->lgd_uid = updata->uid;
00829         lgd->lgd_uuid = updata->obd;
00830 
00831         switch (authtype) {
00832         case AUTHTYPE_KRB5:
00833                 lgd->lgd_mech = (gss_OID) &krb5oid;
00834                 lgd->lgd_req_flags = GSS_C_MUTUAL_FLAG;
00835                 break;
00836         case AUTHTYPE_SPKM3:
00837                 lgd->lgd_mech = (gss_OID) &spkm3oid;
00838                 /* XXX sec.req_flags = GSS_C_ANON_FLAG;
00839                  * Need a way to switch....
00840                  */
00841                 lgd->lgd_req_flags = GSS_C_MUTUAL_FLAG;
00842                 break;
00843         default:
00844                 printerr(0, "Invalid authentication type (%d)\n", authtype);
00845                 return -1;
00846         }
00847 
00848         lgd->lgd_cred = GSS_C_NO_CREDENTIAL;
00849         lgd->lgd_ctx = GSS_C_NO_CONTEXT;
00850         lgd->lgd_rmt_ctx = (gss_buffer_desc) GSS_C_EMPTY_BUFFER;
00851         lgd->lgd_seq_win = 0;
00852 
00853         sname.value = clp->servicename;
00854         sname.length = strlen(clp->servicename);
00855 
00856         maj_stat = gss_import_name(&min_stat, &sname,
00857                                    (gss_OID) GSS_C_NT_HOSTBASED_SERVICE,
00858                                    &lgd->lgd_name);
00859         if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00860                 pgsserr(0, maj_stat, min_stat, lgd->lgd_mech);
00861                 goto out_fail;
00862         }
00863 
00864         retval = gssd_refresh_lgd(lgd);
00865 
00866         if (lgd->lgd_name != GSS_C_NO_NAME)
00867                 gss_release_name(&min_stat, &lgd->lgd_name);
00868 
00869         if (lgd->lgd_cred != GSS_C_NO_CREDENTIAL)
00870                 gss_release_cred(&min_stat, &lgd->lgd_cred);
00871 
00872   out_fail:
00873         return retval;
00874 }
00875 
00876 static
00877 void gssd_free_lgd(struct lustre_gss_data *lgd)
00878 {
00879         gss_buffer_t            token = GSS_C_NO_BUFFER;
00880         OM_uint32               maj_stat, min_stat;
00881 
00882         if (lgd->lgd_ctx == GSS_C_NO_CONTEXT)
00883                 return;
00884 
00885         maj_stat = gss_delete_sec_context(&min_stat, &lgd->lgd_ctx, token);
00886 }
00887 
00888 static
00889 int construct_service_name(struct clnt_info *clp,
00890                            struct lgssd_upcall_data *ud)
00891 {
00892         const int buflen = 256;
00893         char name[buflen];
00894 
00895         if (clp->servicename) {
00896                 free(clp->servicename);
00897                 clp->servicename = NULL;
00898         }
00899 
00900         if (lnet_nid2hostname(ud->nid, name, buflen))
00901                 return -1;
00902 
00903         clp->servicename = malloc(32 + strlen(name));
00904         if (!clp->servicename) {
00905                 printerr(0, "can't alloc memory\n");
00906                 return -1;
00907         }
00908         sprintf(clp->servicename, "%s@%s",
00909                 ud->svc == LUSTRE_GSS_SVC_MDS ?
00910                 GSSD_SERVICE_MDS : GSSD_SERVICE_OSS,
00911                 name);
00912         printerr(2, "constructed servicename: %s\n", clp->servicename);
00913         return 0;
00914 }
00915 
00916 /*
00917  * this code uses the userland rpcsec gss library to create a krb5
00918  * context on behalf of the kernel
00919  */
00920 void
00921 handle_krb5_upcall(struct clnt_info *clp)
00922 {
00923         pid_t                   pid;
00924         gss_buffer_desc         token = { 0, NULL };
00925         struct lgssd_upcall_data updata;
00926         struct lustre_gss_data  lgd;
00927         char                    **credlist = NULL;
00928         char                    **ccname;
00929         int                     read_rc;
00930 
00931         printerr(2, "handling krb5 upcall\n");
00932 
00933         memset(&lgd, 0, sizeof(lgd));
00934         lgd.lgd_rpc_err = -EPERM; /* default error code */
00935 
00936         read_rc = read(clp->krb5_fd, &updata, sizeof(updata));
00937         if (read_rc < 0) {
00938                 printerr(0, "WARNING: failed reading from krb5 "
00939                             "upcall pipe: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00940                 return;
00941         } else if (read_rc != sizeof(updata)) {
00942                 printerr(0, "upcall data mismatch: length %d, expect %d\n",
00943                          read_rc, sizeof(updata));
00944 
00945                 /* the sequence number must be the first field. if read >= 4
00946                  * bytes then we know at least sequence is fine, try to send
00947                  * error notification nicely.
00948                  */
00949                 if (read_rc >= 4)
00950                         do_error_downcall(clp->krb5_fd, updata.seq, -EPERM, 0);
00951                 return;
00952         }
00953 
00954         /* FIXME temporary fix, do this before fork.
00955          * in case of errors could have memory leak!!!
00956          */
00957         if (updata.uid == 0) {
00958                 if (gssd_get_krb5_machine_cred_list(&credlist)) {
00959                         printerr(0, "ERROR: Failed to obtain machine "
00960                                     "credentials\n");
00961                         do_error_downcall(clp->krb5_fd, updata.seq, -EPERM, 0);
00962                         return;
00963                 }
00964         }
00965 
00966         /* fork child process */
00967         pid = fork();
00968         if (pid < 0) {
00969                 printerr(0, "can't fork: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00970                 do_error_downcall(clp->krb5_fd, updata.seq, -EPERM, 0);
00971                 return;
00972         } else if (pid > 0) {
00973                 printerr(2, "forked child process: %d\n", pid);
00974                 return;
00975         }
00976 
00977         printerr(1, "krb5 upcall: seq %u, uid %u, svc %u, nid 0x%llx, obd %s\n",
00978                  updata.seq, updata.uid, updata.svc, updata.nid, updata.obd);
00979 
00980         if (updata.svc != LUSTRE_GSS_SVC_MDS &&
00981             updata.svc != LUSTRE_GSS_SVC_OSS) {
00982                 printerr(0, "invalid svc %d\n", updata.svc);
00983                 lgd.lgd_rpc_err = -EPROTO;
00984                 goto out_return_error;
00985         }
00986         updata.obd[sizeof(updata.obd)-1] = '\0';
00987 
00988         if (construct_service_name(clp, &updata)) {
00989                 printerr(0, "failed to construct service name\n");
00990                 goto out_return_error;
00991         }
00992 
00993         if (updata.uid == 0) {
00994                 int success = 0;
00995 
00996                 /*
00997                  * Get a list of credential cache names and try each
00998                  * of them until one works or we've tried them all
00999                  */
01000 /*
01001                 if (gssd_get_krb5_machine_cred_list(&credlist)) {
01002                         printerr(0, "ERROR: Failed to obtain machine "
01003                                     "credentials for %s\n", clp->servicename);
01004                         goto out_return_error;
01005                 }
01006 */
01007                 for (ccname = credlist; ccname && *ccname; ccname++) {
01008                         gssd_setup_krb5_machine_gss_ccache(*ccname);
01009                         if ((gssd_create_lgd(clp, &lgd, &updata,
01010                                              AUTHTYPE_KRB5)) == 0) {
01011                                 /* Success! */
01012                                 success++;
01013                                 break;
01014                         }
01015                         printerr(2, "WARNING: Failed to create krb5 context "
01016                                     "for user with uid %d with credentials "
01017                                     "cache %s for service %s\n",
01018                                  updata.uid, *ccname, clp->servicename);
01019                 }
01020                 gssd_free_krb5_machine_cred_list(credlist);
01021                 if (!success) {
01022                         printerr(0, "ERROR: Failed to create krb5 context "
01023                                     "for user with uid %d with any "
01024                                     "credentials cache for service %s\n",
01025                                  updata.uid, clp->servicename);
01026                         goto out_return_error;
01027                 }
01028         }
01029         else {
01030                 /* Tell krb5 gss which credentials cache to use */
01031                 gssd_setup_krb5_user_gss_ccache(updata.uid, clp->servicename);
01032 
01033                 if ((gssd_create_lgd(clp, &lgd, &updata, AUTHTYPE_KRB5)) != 0) {
01034                         printerr(0, "WARNING: Failed to create krb5 context "
01035                                     "for user with uid %d for service %s\n",
01036                                  updata.uid, clp->servicename);
01037                         goto out_return_error;
01038                 }
01039         }
01040 
01041         if (serialize_context_for_kernel(lgd.lgd_ctx, &token, &krb5oid)) {
01042                 printerr(0, "WARNING: Failed to serialize krb5 context for "
01043                             "user with uid %d for service %s\n",
01044                          updata.uid, clp->servicename);
01045                 goto out_return_error;
01046         }
01047 
01048         printerr(1, "refreshed: %u@%s for %s\n",
01049                  updata.uid, updata.obd, clp->servicename);
01050         do_downcall(clp->krb5_fd, &updata, &lgd, &token);
01051 
01052 out:
01053         if (token.value)
01054                 free(token.value);
01055 
01056         gssd_free_lgd(&lgd);
01057         exit(0); /* i'm child process */
01058 
01059 out_return_error:
01060         do_error_downcall(clp->krb5_fd, updata.seq,
01061                           lgd.lgd_rpc_err, lgd.lgd_gss_err);
01062         goto out;
01063 }
01064 
01065 /*
01066  * this code uses the userland rpcsec gss library to create an spkm3
01067  * context on behalf of the kernel
01068  */
01069 void
01070 handle_spkm3_upcall(struct clnt_info *clp)
01071 {
01072 #if 0
01073         uid_t                   uid;
01074         CLIENT                  *rpc_clnt = NULL;
01075         AUTH                    *auth = NULL;
01076         struct authgss_private_data pd;
01077         gss_buffer_desc         token;
01078 
01079         printerr(2, "handling spkm3 upcall\n");
01080 
01081         token.length = 0;
01082         token.value = NULL;
01083 
01084         if (read(clp->spkm3_fd, &uid, sizeof(uid)) < sizeof(uid)) {
01085                 printerr(0, "WARNING: failed reading uid from spkm3 "
01086                          "upcall pipe: %s\n", strerror(errno));
01087                 goto out;
01088         }
01089 
01090         if (create_auth_rpc_client(clp, &rpc_clnt, &auth, uid, AUTHTYPE_SPKM3)) {
01091                 printerr(0, "WARNING: Failed to create spkm3 context for "
01092                             "user with uid %d\n", uid);
01093                 goto out_return_error;
01094         }
01095 
01096         if (!authgss_get_private_data(auth, &pd)) {
01097                 printerr(0, "WARNING: Failed to obtain authentication "
01098                             "data for user with uid %d for server %s\n",
01099                          uid, clp->servername);
01100                 goto out_return_error;
01101         }
01102 
01103         if (serialize_context_for_kernel(pd.pd_ctx, &token, &spkm3oid)) {
01104                 printerr(0, "WARNING: Failed to serialize spkm3 context for "
01105                             "user with uid %d for server\n",
01106                          uid, clp->servername);
01107                 goto out_return_error;
01108         }
01109 
01110         do_downcall(clp->spkm3_fd, uid, &pd, &token);
01111 
01112 out:
01113         if (token.value)
01114                 free(token.value);
01115         if (auth)
01116                 AUTH_DESTROY(auth);
01117         if (rpc_clnt)
01118                 clnt_destroy(rpc_clnt);
01119         return;
01120 
01121 out_return_error:
01122         do_error_downcall(clp->spkm3_fd, uid, -1);
01123         goto out;
01124 #endif
01125 }
